Regular forces: part-time service and geographic restrictions
	The Armed Forces Act 2006 is amended as follows.
	Section 329 (terms and conditions of enlistment and service) is amended inaccordance with subsections (3) and (4).
	In subsection (2)—
		after paragraph (h) insert—
		enabling a person to serve with a regular force on a part-time basis;”,and
		for paragraphs (i) and (j) substitute—
		enabling a person’s service with a regular force to be restricted toservice in a particular area or to be subject to other geographicrestrictions;
		requiring a person serving subject to a geographic restriction to servewithout that restriction on a number of occasions not exceeding a prescribedmaximum.”
	After subsection (3) insert—
		“(3A)A right conferred on a person by virtue of subsection (2)(ha) to (j) maybe varied, suspended or terminated in prescribed circumstances.”
	In section 373 (orders, regulations and rules), in subsection (3), afterparagraph (e) insert—
		regulations under section 329(1) which make provision of a kind mentionedin section 329(2)(ha), (i), or (j),
		regulations under section 329(3A),”.
Consequential amendments
	The Juries Act 1974 is amended in accordance with subsections (2) to (4).
	In section 9(2A) and (2B) (excusal for members of armed forces), for “full-time serving member of Her Majesty’s naval, military or air forces” substitute“member of the regular forces”.
	In section 9A(1A), (1C) and (2B)(a) (discretionary deferral for members ofarmed forces), for “full-time serving member of Her Majesty’s naval, militaryor air forces” substitute “member of the regular forces”.
	In section 23(2) (interpretation), at the end insert—
		  * ““regular forces” has the same meaning as in the Armed Forces Act 2006 (see section 374 of that Act).”
	In Part 3 of Schedule 1 to the Law Reform (Miscellaneous Provisions)(Scotland) Act 1980 (persons excusable as of right from jury service), inGroup C, for the words from “Full-time” to the end substitute “Members of theregular forces within the meaning of the Armed Forces Act 2006 (see section374 of that Act).”
Short title, commencement and extent
	This Act may be cited as the Armed Forces (Flexible Working) Act 2018.
	This section comes into force on the day on which this Act is passed.
	Sections 1 and 2 come into force on such day as the Secretary of State mayappoint by regulations.
	Regulations under this section—
		are to be made by statutory instrument, and
		may make different provision for different purposes.
	Section 1 and this section extend to—
		England and Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland,
		the Isle of Man, and
		the British overseas territories, except Gibraltar.
	The power under section 384(2) of the Armed Forces Act 2006 may beexercised so as to modify sections 329 and 373 of that Act, as amended bysection 1 of this Act, as it extends to the Isle of Man or a British overseasterritory other than Gibraltar.
	The power under section 384(1) of the Armed Forces Act 2006 may beexercised so as to extend the amendments made by section 1 of this Act to anyof the Channel Islands (with or without modifications).
	In section 2—
		subsections (1) to (4) extend to England and Wales only, and
		subsection (5) extends to Scotland only.
